objinfo.objsize: full sheet 20.5 x 32.4 cm.Unfolded full sheet and Leaf Size dimensions (height x width) are given according to the vertical orientation of the body of Blake's letter; see the note on Number of Leaves, below. Object 1 has been reoriented vertically in the Object View Page, as would be customary when reading the address.
objinfo.numberleaves: 2The full sheet was folded to form two leaves. The letter appears on the first recto (object 2), first verso (object 3), and second recto (object 4) of the folded sheet. This folded sheet was folded further to form a sealed packet for posting. The address appears on the second verso (object 1), which would have been the exterior of the folded packet. The letter appears to have been repaired along the corner of the leaf containing objects 1 and 4, probably where a wafer seal was torn open. Traces of what appear to be a wafer seal, no longer present, are visible along the edges of the folded letter.
objinfo.sealDesc: Traces of what appears to have been a wafer seal are are visible; see note on Number of Leaves above.

provenance.name: Rosenbach Museum and Library
provenance.note: Dawson Turner; sold with the Dawson Turner collection at Puttick and Simpson's, London, 6-10 June 1859, as part of lot 676, "AUTOGRAPHS: SECOND SERIES; 6 vols." (£24); offered by J.S. Davey for £6.6.o. (Keynes, Letters, page 215); acquired by W. A. White who lent it to the Grolier Club in 1905 and the Fogg Art Museum in 1924; on his death in 1929, sold to A.S.W. Rosenbach; bequeathed to Rosenbach Museum and Library, Philadelphia.

source.repository: Rosenbach Museum and Library2008-2010 Delancey PlacePhiladelphia, Pennsylvannia 19103Telephone, Library: 215-732-1600, ext. 115ine> http://www.rosenbach.orgInventory no. 1010/2

desc.objtitle: Letter to Dawson Turner, 9 June 1818, supplemental views, full sheet view, objects 1 and 2

objnote.p: The full sheet was folded to form two leaves. The letter appears on the first recto (object 2), first verso (object 3), and second recto (object 4) of the folded sheet. This folded sheet was folded further to form a sealed packet for posting. The address appears on the second verso (object 1), which would have been the exterior of the folded packet. The letter appears to have been repaired along the corner of the leaf containing objects 1 and 4, probably where a wafer seal was torn open. Traces of what appear to be a wafer seal, no longer present, are visible along the edges of the folded letter.
In the top left corner, "1010/2" is inscribed in pencil in an unknown hand. Along the top margin, to the right of the central fold line, "E L 3 / .B636 / MS 1" is inscribed in an unknown hand.

desc.objtitle: Letter to Dawson Turner, 9 June 1818, supplemental views, full sheet view, objects 3 and 4

objnote.p: The full sheet was folded to form two leaves. The letter appears on the first recto (object 2), first verso (object 3), and second recto (object 4) of the folded sheet. This folded sheet was folded further to form a sealed packet for posting. The address appears on the second verso (object 1), which would have been the exterior of the folded packet. The letter appears to have been repaired along the corner of the leaf containing objects 1 and 4, probably where a wafer seal was torn open. Traces of what appear to be a wafer seal, no longer present, are visible along the edges of the folded letter.
